channel.title: Leveling the land
channel.description: On my server there is a bunch of useless land and its all up above the ground. I was wondering if there is a way (without destroying it myself) to do some command to level the land.

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

I forced the update as it updated when i did it and i downloaded that exact server and it is not working. Could you TV me?

Read full topic

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

make sure you force update the client. should be loading off of 1.0.0. make sure you use the server in minecraft.net/download, it is also on 1.0.0

sounds like to me that the server or client is out of date

Read full topic

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

I got the client and it loads properly but it says the server responded with an invalid server key.
What should I do about that and it doesn’t let me connect at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

download this:
http://www.megaupload.com/?d=L19EWFJP

place it in your user/appdata/local/

if you dont know how to find that, google it. inside of the download, there is a minecraftsp.exe. run it, type in ANY username, force update checked, and sign in. it will update to the newest client. that should be all for the client. it will connect to the server i sent you in the other topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

So can you link me to the one cause the ones that I have tried have some errors or it doesnt come with a client and its not compatible with the web-client.

Read full topic

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

soo, download the 1.0.0 server and set gamemode to 1(i think). u will be in the newest creative mode with fly and godmode. it looks like from the picture u posted, its a classic server. the reason i say this is because your holding all of the classic blocks, and the lighting looks really bad. there is a difference from the newest creative mode and classic server

Read full topic

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Yes it works like I can open the level in it but its not saving over the previous one.
EDIT: Yes that is what creative mode is. Its a creative server where you start out with everything and you don’t need to earn or really do anything for stuff. I want it to you have to earn your supplies to make things and I want some commands like fly, godmode etc. on the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

from the looks of it, you are running a creative server(not just creative mode.) why not try running a 1.0.0 server from your computer, then try mcedit. im not sure if mc edit works for a server THIS old.

Read full topic

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

lol yeah i must have read it wrong thanks. i got the program but i dont know how to level the land…
EDIT: i figured out how to level the land but when i save the file it doesnt level the land and its like nothing happened.

Read full topic

item.title: Leveling the land
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:424467”]I was pointing out that because you’re in creative mode, destroying it yourself shouldn’t be an issue.[/quote]oic.[quote=“NotLikingThis, post:7, topic:424467”]Yes I can destroy it but I would like to not have to do it myself and just type a command or something I can add so it levels out the land.[/quote]Just open up the level.dat in MCedit and flatten the land.

Read full topic
